701000f-a.folder: Edison Avenue & Randall Avenue, Bronx, NY
701000f-a.text:
Edison Avenue, east side, between Randall and Schley Avenues, showing the J. D. Wolfe Mansion. The G. W. Bromley map of 1900 shows the house to be located on the estate of George Bruce Brown.
June 1926.
Brown Brothers

701001f-a.folder: Edison Avenue & Randall Avenue, Bronx, NY
701001f-a.text:
(1)
Edison Avenue, between Randall and Schley Avenues, showing the old J.D. Wolfe Mansion partially obstructing the continuity of the thoroughfare. The view is south.
July 1, 1928
P.L.Sperr
(2)
Another view of the J.D. Wolfe Mansion.
1920's
W.B.Vernon
(3)
A front view of the house.
E. P. Chrystie
August 23, 1925

701002f-a.folder: Edison Avenue & Randall Avenue, Bronx, NY
701002f-a.text:
Edison Ave., betw. Randall and Schley Aves.
The old J.S. Wolfe mansion, front view.
E.P. Chrystie
Aug. 23, 1925

701003f-a.folder: Edison Avenue & Randall Avenue, Bronx, NY
701003f-a.text:
Edison Avenue, east side, between Randall and Schley Avenues, showing the Wolfe Mansion (Beers' 1867 map). Views 2 and 3 show rear of the house.  It partially obstructs the continuity of Edison Avenue.
P.L. Sparr
July 1, 1928
Views 1,2,3
